intro: Erigeron acris var. armeriifolius, commonly known as the slenderleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and prairies, where it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, giving it a distinctive appearance, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. This variety is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
